newsitem.title: USA: Germany's SAP hit in New York trade.
newsitem.headline: Germany's SAP hit in New York trade.

text.p: Shares in German business software company SAP AG fell about 20 percent in New York trade on Tuesday, hit by disappointing sales, traders said.
They said the stock, which trades in the "pink sheets" of the National Quotation Bureau, was at about 220 marks after closing in Frankfurt at 271.50.
The company reported a nine-month profit of 509 million marks against 385 million marks for the same period the year before.
Sales for the period were 2.372 billion marks versus 1.79 billion marks for the period in 1995. Revenues were below both the company's and the market's expectations.
"The gut feeling down here is that (SAP) doesn't have much further to fall," said Val Kosmider, head of international equity trading at Schroder Wertheim.
"We think some people are just panicking out of it" because of the earnings. "The historical stuff looks OK."
